text: RT @rweingarten I'm so grateful for @SpeakerPelosi's leadership. She got the #FamiliesFirst bill through with a large bipartisan majority. Our communities can't wait, #COVID19 is a threat to our health and our economy. https://appropriations.house.gov/sites/democrats.appropriations.house.gov/files/Families%20First%20Summary%20FINAL.pdf
@jonfavs (The merit of the political strategy of the Dem fight is a different question - we should force the GOP to publicly defend their indefensible positions more and in real time, imo.)

The Senate shouldn’t wait until next week to vote on the emergency coronavirus bill the House has already passed.

Mitch McConnell—call the Senate back immediately to vote on this bill. We need to act.

🚨Attention NY-14

Our Census & Coronavirus tele-town hall is starting at 2pm.

It will be hosted on Zoom & FB Live. Zoom stream will have live closed captioning accessibility & Spanish translation (current tech limits us to 1 language atm)

RSVP info is available @RepAOC.
RT @janeosanders Fireside chat on important issu s at home with @BernieSanders and @fshakir  You can tune in to the livestream now. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETG9HVLXkAA18nf.jpg

ICYMI, I joined @ABCNewsLive from self-quarantine to talk about efforts to combat #COVID19, the importance of social distancing, and what we can all do to stay healthy and help reduce the spread of this virus. 
 
WATCH my full interview here ⤵️ http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1238884890390732807/img/UIg6gOhjl0V8-PTM.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1238884890390732807/vid/480x270/tEAutdlo8r2dJvv1.mp4?tag=13

I'm urging the administration to take 4 IMMEDIATE steps to curb #COVID19 & defeat it:
✔️MAKE testing more accurate & available
✔️ENSURE medical supplies for first responders & healthcare professionals are available
✔️CREATE more capacity for hospitals
✔️WORK quickly to find cures http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETGgWTgWsAEHeIl.jpg

RT @dccc BREAKING: Our House Majority just passed the #FamiliesFirst Act with bipartisan support. House Democrats are working #ForThePeople because we're all in this together as Americans. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETC4VLwWkAEEdDY.jpg
If this situation isn’t a red flag for our current dysfunctional and wasteful health care system, frankly, I don’t know what is.

If you haven’t already, now is the time to check up on your elderly neighbors or those who may not be able to venture outside at this time. See if they need groceries. Offer to help run errands. 

We need to be there for each other.

RT @AOC Every minute, hour, & day that Fed action is delayed on Coronavirus puts lives at risk.

The House has been hammering away at a coronavirus relief package. We just called in every member to vote on & pass a deal at almost 1am.

#WheresMitch McConnell?

Taking the weekend off.

@jonfavs Dems presented a much stronger bill. GOP/WH held it hostage for ~two days and chipped it away.

These negotiations were closed door so it is tough to say who demanded what, but Dems presented their original version so the tracked changes shows the result of GOP/WH negotiation.

Not only are we putting families first, but we are delivering and ensuring the people are kept safe from the #Coronavirus crisis. 

Paid sick leave ✅ 
Enhanced unemployment insurance ✅ 
More funding for Medicaid ✅
Guaranteed food security ✅ 
And testing for all—at no cost. ✅

With schools closing in response to #COVID19 we must ensure the 12 million American students who live in homes without a broadband connection can access the internet to complete their schoolwork. @RepGraceMeng & I have requested emergency funding from the Trump Administration. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETFYAhWWkAExwER.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETFYAhXX0AAiiOL.jpg

We must pursue every step necessary to develop a vaccine & a cure for #COVID19. My RESULTs for Coronavirus Patients Act would allow @US_FDA 30 days to approve pharmaceutical/medical devices approved in another major developed country to help increase access to #coronavirus cures.

@jonfavs Original Dem version is here: 
https://rules.house.gov/sites/democrats.rules.house.gov/files/BILLS-116hr6201ih.pdf

Summary of that original version here: 
https://appropriations.house.gov/sites/democrats.appropriations.house.gov/files/Families%20First%20summary.pdf

On March 7th ⁦@CDCgov⁩ issued updated expert guidance for risk assessment & management for people with potential exposure to #Covid_19 or contacts with confirmed cases. 

Please follow these & not stupid stuff on the internet. #covidvirusupdates  https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/php/risk-assessment.html

The American people deserve better than a cruel, corporate-run health care system that bankrupts people for getting sick. We need Medicare for All. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/ETFhLpgXgAUv9Dx.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1219780046207975424/vid/480x270/59gghBsDO3dQzt35.mp4?tag=13
Great news for @CityofTampa! @FEMA announced more than $1 million to fund the installation of 2 permanent generators to provide backup power as a result of #HurricaneIrma.

The need for social distancing from restaurants only underscores the need for relief for tipped workers, freelancers, shift workers, etc.

Tax credits & unemployment insurance does not help many of these workers - that’s a huge segment of our economy.

We need emergency UBI, now.
In the midst of a major healthcare and economic crisis, we must recognize our common humanity and guarantee healthcare to all of our people—as a human right, not a privilege.
The pharmaceutical industry must be told in no uncertain terms that the medicines that they manufacture for this crisis will be sold at cost. This is not the time for profiteering or price gouging.

.⁦@USDA⁩ has issued guidance to all states on waivers for the school based meal programs. This should allow all states with school closures,including #Florida, to continue providing meals to students through June 30, 2020.

#Sayfie  https://www.fns.usda.gov/cn/child-nutrition-program-waiver-request-guidance-and-protocol-revised

We need to make sure first responders and healthcare professionals have what they need to stay safe and healthy and we need to increase capacity at our hospitals and make sure they have enough medical equipment.
 
These steps are critical to combatting #coronavirus. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1238884890390732807/img/UIg6gOhjl0V8-PTM.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1238884890390732807/vid/480x270/tEAutdlo8r2dJvv1.mp4?tag=13

Good advice — not just for NYC, but everywhere.

If you can stay home, stay home. 

And wash your hands. https://twitter.com/aoc/status/1238860728565747714 QT @AOC To everyone in NYC but ESPECIALLY healthy people & people under 40 (bc from what I’m observing that’s who needs to hear this again):

PLEASE stop crowding bars, restaurants, and public spaces right now. Eat your meals at home.

If you are healthy, you could be spreading COVID.

With kids across the country now staying home from school, it’s especially important for seniors to physically isolate themselves from the rest of the family. Seniors’ high #Covid19 mortality demands high vigilance.

Last night the House passed a bill that's an important first step to help us combat #COVID19—free testing for all who need it, paid sick leave, expanded unemployment insurance & more. Senator McConnell needs to call the Senate back into session so we can vote. Lives are at stake.

We need to do more to make #COVID19 tests more widely available. 

We’ve made major steps in the last 48 hours in that regard. 

I’ve been urging the Admin to make the tests widely available so that anyone who is experiencing symptoms can be tested. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1238884890390732807/img/UIg6gOhjl0V8-PTM.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1238884890390732807/vid/480x270/tEAutdlo8r2dJvv1.mp4?tag=13

RT @StevenTDennis Mnuchin gives a shoutout to his negotiating partner, Nancy Pelosi. 

Pretty darn rare to see any praise across the aisle in this town.
McConnell must immediately call the Senate back in session to vote on the House-passed coronavirus relief package. Families can’t wait.

Who is a God like you,who removes guilt & pardons sin...;Who does not persist in anger forever,but instead delights in mercy & will again have compassion on us,treading underfoot our iniquities? You will cast into the depths of the sea all our sins

Micah 7:18-19

- Help small businesses provide the goods & services we need to deal with #COVIDー19

🇮🇪 52

🇯🇵 52

🇦🇺 52

🇱🇺 52
🇨🇿 52
🇧🇪 52
🇳🇴 52
🇫🇷 52
🇸🇮 52
🇺🇸 0

We must join the rest of the industrialized world and guarantee paid sick leave to every single worker in America.

Together, we will get through this.

Thank you to all of the courageous doctors, nurses, first responders, cleaning staff, and so many others who find themselves on the frontlines of this public health emergency. We owe each of them a tremendous debt of gratitude.

I spent weeks  pushing this. Right now the answer is we don’t have one. 

We can produce ventilators but we need component parts from other nations (including #China). 

We need all hands on deck on this now. 

And moving forward we MUST rebuild our nations industrial capacity. https://twitter.com/jimpethokoukis/status/1238887386119057408 QT @JimPethokoukis And what is the status of America's crash ventilator production program? Have we gotten an update on that?

We are working to get the @FCC to issue a waiver to local school districts with #COVIDー19 related closures so that funds from their E-Rate program can be used to provide tablets & other devices to students without them, so they can access online learning.

RT @theferocity As someone who grew up with a single parent, living paycheck to paycheck, I can feel the anxiety and stress taking hold of families across the country right now. This crisis has laid bare the brutality of American life as we know it.

Slowing the rate of infection of #COVID-19 must now be our MOST URGENT PRIORITY

3 to 5% of those infected will need ventilators

At most we can provide ventilators for roughly 135000 patients

What does “crowded” mean?

If you can’t stay 6ft away from other people, it’s too close. In general, when going outside try to stay at least 6 feet away from others as much as you possibly can.

@ErikaKlash @SenSchumer @SenGillibrand Hi, Erika - have you verified I am your rep and left a voicemail? DM me.
